narrative.title: Scene 15-6 — If Knuckle Escapes With the Blanket
paragraphs: Knuckle charged away with the blanket clutched in his huge paw. With time running short, the stuffies rushed down each crowded lane and bought a similar blanket from a nearby stall. It wasn’t the same, but it would still keep their child warm. Holding the replacement close, they gathered themselves and prepared to leave Squalor behind.

vocabulary.definition: The foot of an animal that has fur, claws, or pads.
examples: The cat placed its paw on her arm.
Mud covered the dog’s paws after the walk.

vocabulary.definition: Filled with too many people or things.
examples: The bus was crowded and there were no seats left.
They avoided the crowded market during the holiday.

vocabulary.definition: Having less and less of something, with the supply almost gone.
examples: We are running short on time, so let’s hurry.
The store was running short on bottled water after the storm.

vocabulary.definition: Almost the same, but not completely identical.
examples: Their opinions were similar even though they hadn’t discussed them.

vocabulary.definition: A narrow road or path, often between fields or buildings.
examples: They walked down a quiet country lane.
Cars filled every lane on the busy highway.

vocabulary.definition: Held something tightly, often because of fear or worry.
examples: She clutched the handle of her bag on the train.
The child clutched his toy and refused to let go.

vocabulary.definition: Moved or acted quickly, often because there was little time.
examples: They rushed to catch the last bus.
He rushed through his homework so he could play.

vocabulary.definition: Something that takes the place of what was lost, broken, or used before.
examples: She needed a replacement for her broken watch.
They bought a replacement part for the old machine.

events.text: Knuckle runs off with the blanket in his massive paw.
The stuffies realize time is running short.
They buy a similar blanket from the market.
They accept the replacement to keep their child warm.
The group prepares to leave Squalor.

distractors: Knuckle returns the blanket after feeling guilty.
The stuffies discover the blanket was never stolen at all.
A vendor refuses to sell any blankets to outsiders.
